newsitem.title: UK: P&O up as NatWest repeats "buy" stance.
newsitem.headline: P&O up as NatWest repeats "buy" stance.

text.p: Shares in Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Co Plc (P&O) rose on Tuesday as NatWest repeated a "buy" rating and the stock responded to Monday's French clearance for its channel merger with Stena .
By 0950 GMT P&O shares were up 6-1/2p to 645-1/2p.
"The okay from the French government is encouraging", one trader said. "And it would make sense for both companies."

P&O should also benefit from higher sales as many Britons were said to spend their windfall profits of the Halixfax flotation on holidays, dealers said. Windfall profits totalling 17 billion stg were expected from the Halifax float.
Analysts at NatWest were not immediately available for comment.
A ruling on the merger from the European Commission is expected by mid-June.

P&O and Stena last October announced plans to merge their cross channel operations to compete with the channel tunnel. The new company would operate routes Dover-Calais, Dover-Zeebrugge and Newhaven-Dieppe.
